subject: Physical Fitness
title: Fear-Avoidance and Deconditioning
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Fear-Avoidance and Deconditioning.

hook.text: You hurt your back once. Now you avoid bending, lifting, and exercise entirely. The fear becomes worse than the injury.

buildup.text: Fear-avoidance is when pain leads to fear, fear leads to avoidance, and avoidance leads to deconditioning.

discovery.text: The weaker and stiffer you become from avoiding movement, the more things hurt. It's a vicious spiral.

twist.text: Catastrophizing â€” believing pain means serious damage â€” is the strongest predictor of chronic pain development.

climax.text: Gradual return to movement breaks the cycle. Controlled exposure proves the body is stronger than fear suggests.

punchline.text: Avoiding movement to avoid pain creates more pain. Motion is lotion.

quiz.question: What is the fear-avoidance cycle?
options: Pain causes fear, fear causes movement avoidance, avoidance causes deconditioning and more pain
A training method for overcoming phobias
A warm-up technique to prevent injury
